Package org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.alt

Class AbstractAltAutomaton

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractEditable
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.Automaton
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.alt.AbstractAltAutomaton
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, Editable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AltAutomaton, TwoWayAltAutomaton
public abstract class AbstractAltAutomaton
extends Automaton
An AbstractAltAutomaton is a structure for automata with alternation which can be in DNF form or CNF form. To distinguish between existential states and universal states, we use AltState objects (alternating states) for existential states in DNF form and universal states in CNF form, while AltConnector (alternating connectors) objects are used for universal states in DNF form and existential states in CNF form. A transition cannot connect two universal states in DNF form, or two existential states in CNF form. A transition from an universal state to an existential state in DNF form (or from an existential state to an universal state in CNF form) cannot have any label.
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai
See Also:
Serialized Form

      public boolean addTransition​(Transition t)
      Description copied from class: Automaton
      Inserts a transition created outside to this automaton. The transition will not be added if there is another existing transition (1) with the same ID or (2) with the same starting state, ending state, and label.
      Overrides:
      addTransition in class Automaton
      Parameters:
      t - the transition to be added to this automaton
      Returns:
      true if the transition is inserted successfully

    • createTransition

      public AltTransition createTransition​(State from, State to, java.lang.String label)
      Description copied from class: Automaton
      Creates a transition to the automaton. The returned transition is guaranteed to be in this automaton.
      Overrides:
      createTransition in class Automaton
      Parameters:
      from - the source state of the transition
      to - the destination state of the transition
      label - the label on the transition
      Returns:
      a new transition from from to to with label symbol if there is no such transition, the existing transition if this automaton has a transition from from to to with the label symbol, null if from is null, to is null, or the symbol is not valid

    • createTransition

      public AltTransition createTransition​(AltState from, StateSet tos, java.lang.String symbol)
      Creates an alternating transition by giving the source state and a set of destination states. If there are multiple destination states, a connector will be added for connecting the source state with each destination state.
      Parameters:
      from - the source state of the alternating transition
      tos - the destination states of the alternating transition
      symbol - the label of the alternating transition
      Returns:
      a transition from the source state to an alternating connector if there are multiple destination states, otherwise a transition from the source state to the single destination state

    • createTransition

      public AltTransition createTransition​(AltState from, java.util.Set<AltState> tos, java.lang.String symbol)
      Creates an alternating transition by giving the source state and a set of destination states. If there are multiple destination states, a connector will be added for connecting the source state with each destination state.
      Parameters:
      from - the source state of the alternating transition
      tos - the destination states of the alternating transition
      symbol - the label of the alternating transition
      Returns:
      a transition from the source state to an alternating connector if there are multiple destination states, otherwise a transition from the source state to the single destination state

    • clone

      public AbstractAltAutomaton clone()
      Overrides:

    • getAltSuccessors

      public java.util.Set<StateSet> getAltSuccessors​(State state)
      Returns all successors of a state, excluding alternating connectors. Suppose that there are transitions from state to s1, s2, ..., and sn. For each si, there will be a state set denoting the successors. If si is an alternating state, the corresponding state set will be a singleton containing only si. If si is an alternating connector, the corresponding state set will be all successors of si.
      Parameters:
      state - a source state
      Returns:
      all successors of state

    • getAltSuccessors

      public java.util.Set<StateSet> getAltSuccessors​(State state, java.lang.String symbol)
      Returns all α-successors of a state, excluding alternating connectors. Suppose that there are transitions labeled by symbol from state to s1 , s2, ..., and sn. For each si, there will be a state set denoting the α-successors. If si is an alternating state, the corresponding state set will be a singleton containing only si. If si is an alternating connector, the corresponding state set will be all successors of si.
      Parameters:
      state - a source state
      symbol - a symbol in the alphabet
      Returns:
      all α-successors of state

    • getAltSuccessors

      public java.util.Set<StateSet> getAltSuccessors​(StateSet states, java.lang.String symbol)
      Returns all combinations of α-successors of a set of states.
      Parameters:
      states - a set of states
      symbol - a symbol
      Returns:
      all combinations of α-successors of states
